title: [Large-Scale] Workshop on Prioritizing Instructional Design Competencies in Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational instructional design theories and mathematics education experience
context.additional_context: Deriving practice-oriented competency priorities through self-reflection and peer feedback activities using Q methodology

learning_goals: Learners can select three priority instructional design competencies from IBSTPIâ€™s 22 teaching design competencies that align with their practical style in mathematics education

Learners can select and apply core competencies (learner analysis, content development, collaboration strategies) when designing mathematics education aligned with project-based learning scenarios
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
